Ensuring communities have safe, clean water is a key to expanding quality, affordable housing. 

I met with @NHHousing today to discuss provisions in the bipartisan infrastructure law that will invest in our water infrastructure and help address the pressing need for housing. https://t.co/xeiyfn9ajO

The opioid crisis continues to harm our state, and we need a comprehensive approach to stop fentanyl from hitting our streets.

I joined a briefing with the New England High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area team to discuss the work being done to bring traffickers to justice. https://t.co/8BKvCsi6gH

Last week I spoke on @WMUR9 about the importance of the TRUST In Congress Act, a bipartisan bill that prevents insider trading by elected officials.
 
No member of Congress, or their family members, should profit off public service. https://t.co/Dih5kFTro3

Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine must be strongly condemned and met with consequences.
 
I called for swift, harsh sanctions against Russia which are now being implemented. The international community must stand united against these actions. 

https://t.co/6ZqPYaUG6i

Addressing the addiction epidemic in New Hampshire requires a multi-faceted solution.
 
The Laconia Police Department's prevention program takes a collaborative approach to connect community members with the resources they need.

Read more about it here: 
https://t.co/8xRHZIUgzy

Last week I visited the new Families First community health center facility in Portsmouth.
 
As we saw during COVID-19, the role community health centers play is vital. We need to ensure everyone has access to quality care. This space will bring more resources to the Seacoast. https://t.co/v0ujk9NUQ8

Recently, I toured Memorial Hospital in North Conway and learned more about their new apprenticeship program to combat health care worker shortages.

Our community continues to think of new and innovative ways to solve pressing issues.

Read more:

https://t.co/rZRnGempVi

This morning I had the chance to hear from Granite Staters about the urgent need to lower the skyrocketing cost of prescription drugs.

No one should go bankrupt over basic medications. I remain committed to fighting to lower these costs for New Hampshire families. https://t.co/U1gip1Ylux

Recent studies have shown the COVID-19 pandemic disrupted annual cancer screenings and other preventative measures.

Luckily, NH Healthy Lives has published a list of free screening sites in NH that you can check out here‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/tROsP8FB8e

I was saddened to learn about the passing of my colleague, Rep. Jim Hagedorn. We worked together on efforts to support our small businesses during COVID-19.

I'm thankful for his service and send my condolences to his loved ones during this difficult time.

As we continue to address the addiction crisis, we must equip our communities with the resources to respond.

I visited Laconia Police Department today to learn about their innovative program that connects law enforcement with local resources to get people the help they need. https://t.co/TEWtaUUo9S

Filing taxes can be a difficult process to navigate. Luckily, the @IRSnews created a new page as a guide and to provide updates during this tax season. 

If you have any questions or need any assistance, feel free to contact my office (603) 285-4300

https://t.co/ZersWKaGws

Today I met with the NH postal workers and leadership to discuss the Postal Reform Act. 

This bipartisan legislation provides crucial reforms to @USPS. This includes six-day delivery, performance transparency measures, and other vital changes. 

Let's pass this bill into law. https://t.co/Ghk3jhUJVl
Thank you, @BGCofManchester! https://t.co/FoO7DFsnEd

I visited the VA Medical Center in Manchester this morning to drop off Valentines for veterans that our office collected from students throughout New Hampshire. I also took a tour of the new urgent care facility helping more veterans access the care and services they need. https://t.co/o1C2EtFQRL

The Queen City Bridge is a vital artery in Manchester undergoing needed renovations. Repairing the roads and bridges Granite Staters use every day is critically important, and that's why federal investments like the bipartisan infrastructure law are so vital. https://t.co/wdiXVlJBGP

These bills will guarantee survivors of military sexual trauma equal access to benefits and care, increase access to cancer screenings, and expand fertility care for veterans and families.

It‚Äôs time VA ensures women veterans are afforded these benefits.

https://t.co/Oa97ZEbGk5

I called for a ban on members of Congress trading stocks last year and support legislation that would bring about this change. Speaker Pelosi was dead wrong to oppose it.

This is a vital step, but anyone who is serious about change knows we must do more. 
https://t.co/0WkLXdSdbQ

Thank you @BGCofManchester for helping with our Valentines for Veterans program! We've been collecting Valentines from students across the state to share with New Hampshire veterans next week, and these will be a great addition.

It's always fun to stop by the Clubhouse! https://t.co/4wU5dWm1I0

Natural disasters are causing more damage on a more frequent basis. This bipartisan bill improves FEMA‚Äôs ability to respond and provide goods and services to those affected. I‚Äôll keep working to ensure our communities can recover quickly from disasters.

https://t.co/lmaq9pyzGX

For too long VA has failed to provide necessary care to our women veterans. These bills would help support the health and well-being of New Hampshire‚Äôs women veterans and their families.

I‚Äôll keep working to advance these priorities and push for passage.

https://t.co/xxtNvlnipW

Joined the Exeter Housing Advisory Committee this morning to discuss the assistance in the bipartisan infrastructure law to help create additional housing throughout New Hampshire.  Clean water and modern infrastructure are vital pieces of the housing puzzle for every community. https://t.co/R3buLodyqI

Wrapped up a full day with a stop at the VA clinic in Conway. Community-Based Outpatient Clinics (CBOC) help to make access to health care easier and more convenient for veterans. Thank you to the team for the work you do caring for our heroes. https://t.co/aHJ6ewnfst

Sat down with some members of the Mt. Washington Valley Economic Council for a conversation about the Valley‚Äôs Main Street economy. It‚Äôs always fun to visit with Kennett High School‚Äôs AP Government class. Thank you for welcoming me to class and for all your thoughtful questions. I see plenty of future leaders in this group! https://t.co/VJNJhbxT1L

Just wrapped up a tour of Memorial Hospital to learn more about an innovative partnership with White Mountains Community College to train medical assistants. Federal relief like the Shuttered Venue Operators Grant program and the Economic Injury Disaster Loan program helped the show go on at M&D Playhouse. It was great to drop by to meet with their team and check in.

Barefoot In The Park debuts tonight! https://t.co/ujIoxdEX9o
Popped into @frontsidegrind in North Conway to warm up with a tea and conversation before heading back out on the road. https://t.co/Y9WzUrSLAB

.@USPS is a bedrock institution that delivers for Granite State households, businesses, and communities. I voted to pass this bipartisan bill to preserve and strengthen the Postal Service, and I urge the Senate to quickly send it to President Biden's desk.
https://t.co/TB2kdaokB5

I voted to keep our government open by supporting the continuing resolution. While this is necessary to ensure we fund vital services, pay federal workers, and prevent any possibility of a shutdown, we must prioritize passing a full appropriations bill.

https://t.co/vTDvIsymaa

On #SaferInternetDay, I'm joining @RepSusanWild in calling on @YouTube to remove "How To Tie a Noose" videos. At a time when adolescent suicide rates are on the rise, taking this step could save lives. https://t.co/FEKYzuLmPC

Telehealth has allowed Granite Staters to receive essential care without increasing their risk from COVID-19 throughout the pandemic. I'm pleased New Hampshire will be receiving these federal funds to continue to improve and expand telehealth services.

https://t.co/IqwudMjCQO

Our local governments are on the front lines of the pandemic and play a vital role in the lives of Granite Staters. 

That's why I've fought to get communities resources to address COVID-19, hire police and first responders, and invest in infrastructure. 

https://t.co/X0OrWkPhgc

This morning I was joined by New Hampshire manufacturers for a roundtable conversation on the importance of strengthening domestic manufacturing and our supply chains.

It is vital to our economic and national security interests that we make more products right here in America. https://t.co/aYQGgugjLD

NEWS: The VA just announced it is implementing new guidelines for processing veteran debt to comply with bipartisan legislation I introduced and worked to pass last year.

We cannot let the financial futures of our heroes be needlessly burdened by debt.

https://t.co/zI52TjaFZG

I secured several amendments, including one to ensure U.S. small businesses and manufacturers are prioritized for Department of Homeland Security procurement contracts for goods like uniforms and protective gear. 

I spoke on the House floor yesterday about this effort ‚¨áÔ∏è 2/2 https://t.co/QbbBxIUFou

This is a win for workers and manufacturing companies making products right here in New Hampshire. 1/2

https://t.co/Ko998cFNBz

I introduced an amendment to the America COMPETES Act to support domestic manufacturing and American small businesses. I'll continue to fight for legislation that helps create more good-paying jobs, supports domestic manufacturing, and strengthens our supply chain.

Learn more ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/UstEG4pm1U

I called on the Biden Administration to make free over-the-counter COVID-19 testing available to those on Medicare, and I'm pleased they've taken this step.

I'll continue to urge the Administration to lower costs and ensure testing is widely accessible.

https://t.co/Nj7pj9nSG6

As the Olympics begin, the Chinese government has intensified persecution against those who speak out. 

I've called on the Biden Administration to ensure our athletes remain safe from arbitrary retribution against them while competing for Team USA.

https://t.co/d9Xj49dwmX

Our libraries are community hubs and gathering places that provide internet access, educational resources, cultural experiences, and more. Yesterday I joined some great Granite State librarians to discuss library funding through the American Rescue Plan.

https://t.co/7xsUa5t1UD

A conflict between state law and a federal rule could delay the training of NH commercial drivers. That's why I joined with our federal delegation to call for this waiver to help address the issue and ensure our truck driving workforce is on the road.

Wrapping up another busy week here in the First District! But before the weekend, I wanted to share a few of the highlights of what I've been working on.

Take a look back at our #TeamPappas Rewind and get caught up ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/gsdaRwtgMX

The #EarnedIncomeTaxCredit helps families make ends meet and puts more money back in their pockets. But you must file a tax return to receive it.

That's why I held a webinar today to share tax-filing resources & EITC information.

Watch the full webinar: https://t.co/EJEvMT9lEC https://t.co/cGwIhJ7uTY

Christa McAuliffe knew that history is defined by ordinary people doing extraordinary things. She dared to touch the future as a teacher and an astronaut. On the 36th anniversary of the Challenger tragedy, I join all Granite Staters in honoring her legacy.
https://t.co/4CcsionPYk

Through the bipartisan infrastructure law, New Hampshire is receiving additional funding to help Granite Staters heat their homes this winter. This is a record amount, and I'm committed to ensuring New Hampshire has all the federal support we need.

https://t.co/OV4awePiGA

Today I visited Hampton following the recent winter storm flooding to discuss climate resiliency provisions in the bipartisan infrastructure law. Dropped by @UofNH this morning to catch up with @UNHPoliceChief Dean. Today on #HolocaustRemembranceDay, 77 years after the liberation of Auschwitz-Birkenau, #WeRemember and we honor the lives of 6 million Jews murdered in the Holocaust. We must always reject bigotry, hatred, and anti-Semitism to ensure that this history is never repeated.

Legislation I introduced will fund teams of local law enforcement, first responders, and child specialists to mitigate the impact of trauma experienced by kids. I also helped introduce the Homes for Every Local Protector, Educator, and Responder (HELPER) Act establishes a program to provide mortgage assistance to law enforcement officers, elementary and secondary school teachers, firefighters, or other first responders. 8/8

The Violent Incident Clearance and Technological Investigative Methods (VICTIM) Act is legislation I helped introduce to establish a grant program to provide resources to local law enforcement agencies to help increase clearance rates for homicides and non-fatal shootings. 7/8

The National ACERT Grant Program Authorization Act  will provide resources for law enforcement and first responders to connect with local child specialists and professionals to intervene and mitigate the impacts of childhood trauma. 6/8

The FIGHT Act will will keep deadly synthetic drugs off our streets and hold traffickers accountable by placing fentanyl-related substances permanently on the Schedule I list. 5/8

https://t.co/vzyusG6lYW

The Invest to Protect Act is bipartisan legislation that will secure funding for small police departments to improve training and standards, recruit and retain officers, acquire body camera data storage, and provide mental health resources for officers. 2/8

From the COVID-19 to the addiction crisis and spikes in crime and violence, law enforcement and first responders need additional support to meet our communities‚Äô needs and keep people safe.

That's why I helped introduce the Invest to Protect Act 1/8

Congratulations, Jackson, on being named the 'safest small town' in New Hampshire!

https://t.co/sKCuc9zc5M

The EVEST Act will automatically enroll veterans in VA health care services. This will help meet mental health needs, increase access to health care, and put our veterans on a path to success following their military service.

We can't let the Dec. 15 monthly check be the last. We must continue this lifeline.

REMINDER: Open Enrollment ends at midnight on January 15th! Enroll in an affordable health insurance plan to #GetCovered in 2022.

I continue to urge the administration to revise its approach so that we do not place unworkable or unnecessarily burdensome requirements on businesses who are still struggling to recover from the ongoing pandemic. 3/4

Hate has no home here. 

Last week I visited @TheSeacoastRep ‚Äãto share my support for the Honey Punch and Pals team. Standing together and against hate is what Granite Staters do, and I couldn't be more proud of how our community has come together.

From landfill to solar array! This is great news as we work towards a clean energy future. I toured the site last year, and I'm pleased it has come online. Grateful for @MayorJoyceCraig and Manchester's partners who worked for years to make this happen.

We believe that a more realistic approach is needed to encourage vaccinations, ensure workplace safety, and support our local economies that are just getting back on their feet.

This morning I joined the ribbon cutting at the Naval Branch Health Clinic at Portsmouth Naval Shipyard and took a tour of the new facility. This clinic will help ensure that those working on behalf of our national security and readiness have access to the care they need. https://t.co/xjHXyZoc7Z

Now is a time to stand together, seek accountability for those who perpetrated the violent insurrection, and protect our democracy so that such an attack can never succeed as it nearly did on January 6, 2021. 4/4

I stand with members of law enforcement and the U.S. Capitol Police, thank them for their service, and mourn their losses. 

January 6th shook us to our core. But my commitment to upholding my oath to preserve, protect, and defend our Constitution remains as strong as ever. 3/4

While a year has passed, the physical and psychological wounds of that day are still felt by all. Our democracy remains under threat from those who persist in peddling the lies that sparked the assault and seek to rewrite history by downplaying or denying what we all saw. 2/4

As we approach the one-year anniversary of the deadly insurrection on the Capitol, Congress must do all we can to adequately fund law enforcement, like the US Capitol Police, and first responders who are charged with keeping our communities, families, and our democracy safe. 2/2
